citation.article-title: Algoriphagus lutimaris sp. nov., isolated from a tidal flat sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Algoriphagus lutimaris sp. nov.
Algoriphagus lutimaris (lu.ti.ma′ris. L. n. lutum mud; L. gen. n. maris of the sea, marine; N.L. gen. n. lutimaris of a marine mud).
Cells are Gram-staining-negative, non-spore-forming, non-flagellated and short rods or rods (0.4–0.7×0.8–4.5 μm); a few cells longer than 10 μm are also observed.
Colonies on MA are circular, convex, smooth, glistening, reddish-orange in colour and 1.0–1.5 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at 4 (weak) and 40 °C (optimum 30 °C) but not at 45 °C, at pH 5.0 (optimum pH 7.0–8.0) but not at pH 4.5 and with 0–8.0 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 2 % NaCl).
Mg2+ ions are required for growth.
Growth does not occur under anaerobic conditions on MA or on MA supplemented with nitrate.
The major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and iso-C15 : 0.
Other phenotypic properties are shown in Table 1.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 41.4 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, S1-3T (=KCTC 22630T =CCUG 57608T), was isolated from sediment of a tidal flat at Saemankum on the west coast of Korea.
